<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 17"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Impenetrable Scale](/Equipment.aspx?ID=154)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 558 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 12,800 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn armor

**Bulk** 3
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Armor** [Scale Mail](/Armor.aspx?ID=8)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Made of overlapping, lustrous black scales of standard-grade adamantine, this _+2 greater resilient [fortification](/Equipment.aspx?ID=285) [adamantine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=139) [scale mail](/Armor.aspx?ID=8)_ seems to momentarily thicken at the point of impact when hit. Whenever the armor’s _fortification_ rune successfully turns a significant foe’s critical hit into a normal hit, one of the scales on the armor turns violet. You gain resistance to physical damage equal to the number of violet scales, to a maximum of 8.

 At dawn each day, all the violet scales return to normal.

**Craft Requirements** The initial raw materials must include 1,600 gp of adamantine.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Impenetrable Scale
